page.title: 11Religion
page.content: There are only two churches in the area, one in Eaton Constantine and one in Wroxeter. The Eaton Constantine church is a small church built in 1850 to replace an earlier building on the same site. There are Church of England services each Sunday lead by the Vicar who lives in the village. He is also in charge of worship in other villages nearby. The church at Wroxeter is a much older and more beautiful building but is no longer used as it is unsafe. As there are so few people in the area to use this church it will be repaired but not used for regular worship. People of other religious groups have to travel to the nearby towns or Shrewsbury or Telford to go to Church.
